content.title: Financial Assistance On Marriage Of Children (HBOCWWB)
content.department: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance on Marriage of Children (HBOCWWB)' was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana. Under this scheme, a provision has been made to provide financial assistance of ₹21,000/- for a son’s marriage and ₹50,000/- for a daughter's marriage for making arrangements for the marriage of the son/daughter of a construction worker three days before the marriage. This assistance shall be sanctioned for the marriage of two children of the beneficiary provided that the benefits shall be extended up to three daughters.
benefits: The financial assistance of ₹21,000/- for the son’s marriage and ₹50,000/- for the daughter's marriage will be given to a registered construction worker for making arrangements of the marriage of his/her son/daughter.
The financial assistance shall be sanctioned for the marriage of two children of the beneficiary provided that the benefits shall be extended up to three daughters.
eligibility: The worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB).
The registered worker should have a minimum of one-year regular membership.
The worker should have the attested marriage card of his/her son/daughter.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card

faqs.question: What is the objective of scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance of ₹21,000/- for a son’s marriage and ₹50,000/- for a daughter's marriage for making arrangements for the marriage of the son/daughter of a construction worker.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The registered worker who has a minimum of one-year regular membership is eligible to apply under the scheme for financial assistance for making arrangements for the marriage of his/her son/daughter.

faqs.question: Can a general category worker be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of workers.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident/domicile of Haryana State.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance of ₹21,000/- for the son’s marriage and ₹50,000/- for the daughter's marriage will be given to a registered construction worker for making arrangements for the marriage of his/her son/daughter.

faqs.question: How many children of a construction worker can be benefited by the scheme?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance shall be sanctioned for the marriage of two children of the beneficiary provided that the benefits shall be extended up to three daughters.

faqs.question: Within how many days the worker has to submit the marriage certificate to the concerned office?
faqs.answer: The worker will write in writing that he/she will submit the certificate of marriage in the office of the concerned Assistant Director within a period of six months otherwise he/she will not be eligible for any benefit under any welfare scheme in the future.

faqs.question: Is the worker required to submit an undertaking?
faqs.answer: Yes, the worker shall submit an undertaking/self-declaration that he/she has not received this assistance from any other Government Department/Board/Corporation and will not do so.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker get registered under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: For registration, the construction worker should visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Is there any registration fee needed while registering under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Yes, the first-time registration charges are ₹25/- and the registration fees vary according to the renewal time period.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply online mode.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the applicant should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
